metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0391 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Python, specifically within the urllib.parse module. This module helps break Uniform Resource Locator (URL) strings into components. The issue involves how the urlparse method does not sanitize input and allows characters like '\r' and '\n' in the URL path. This flaw allows an attacker to input a crafted URL, leading to injection attacks. This flaw affects Python versions prior to 3.10.0b1, 3.9.5, 3.8.11, 3.7.11 and 3.6.14.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0391` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-examples - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-full - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-venv - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.7-1
python3.9 - 3.9.7-1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.7-1
python3.9-full - 3.9.7-1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.7-1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.7-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> for python2.7 code affected, urlsplit is in Lib/urlparse.py. according with Debian, the fix for python3.5 causes regressions.

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4').
python3.9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.7-1').
